channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘A deadly confluence of wrong-way news’ is what’s causing the global market selloff, says top economist, and don’t expect it to get better anytime soon
item.description: Hopes for an interest rate cut from the Fed are fading despite a global slowdown and a spike in the VIX.

item.title: A $7 Billion Opioid Reckoning, and Trump’s Defense of the Saudi Crown Prince
item.description: Plus, young men are flocking to the Orthodox Church.

item.title: Here’s Who’s Attending Trump’s Dinner for the Saudi Crown Prince: Elon Musk, Cristiano Ronaldo and more.
item.description: Here are some of the guests invited to President Trump’s dinner for Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia.

item.title: Who’s Running to Replace Jerry Nadler? 10 People and Counting.
item.description: Mr. Nadler’s coveted House seat in Manhattan will be up for grabs next year in a district that is the wealthiest in New York.

item.title: Nvidia’s earnings could answer the AI bubble question and upend global markets in moment of truth for Magnificent 7
item.description: A historic capex surge, thin AI revenues, and extreme index concentration leave investors one disappointment away from a broad‑based equity shock.

item.title: Navy Secretary warns workers can make more at Amazon instead of building America’s warships: ‘It’s hard to get that person to want to do that job’
item.description: The industry contributes $37.3 billion to GDP, but has been outshined by China in recent years.

item.title: Russia Pounds Ukraine Even as Zelensky Aims to Revive Peace Talks
item.description: At least 19 people were killed in the city of Ternopil when missiles hit a residential building, the authorities there said.

item.title: Big 5 AI ‘hyperscalers’ have quadrupled their use of debt to fund operations, Bank of America says
item.description: All five companies companies generate more than enough cash to cover their operations but the arrival of debt vehicles to fund AI has complicated the ...

item.title: How CEOs can stay clear-eyed during the stock market’s AI selloff
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Climate Change Is Stressing Italy’s Cows, and Coming for Your Burrata
item.description: Extreme heat causes cows to produce less milk. This poses problems in cheese-obsessed Italy, especially as it tries to meet growing demand for favorit...

item.title: Russia Pounds Ukraine Even as Zelensky Aims to Revive Peace Talks
item.description: At least 19 people were killed in the city of Ternopil when missiles hit a residential building, the authorities there said.

item.title: Old Divides of East and West Haunt Germany’s Newest Arrivals
item.description: Refugees who poured into the country a decade ago fared better when they landed in the more prosperous West, an enduring legacy of reunification.

item.title: Patreon’s C.E.O.: My Vision for a Better Internet
item.description: The internet should enrich people, not advertisers.

item.title: Two Miss Universe Judges Resign Before Finale, Deepening a Crisis
item.description: One accused the competition of being rigged. It is the second scandal to roil the pageant after an organizer berated a contestant in public.

item.title: Zelensky Under Siege as Corruption Case Shatters Ukraine’s Wartime Unity
item.description: An anti-Zelensky political coalition is coalescing as the president’s allies are accused of enriching themselves while the country’s soldiers die on t...
